title: Path resolution tests fail due to macOS /private symlink
description:
## Summary
Project root finding tests fail on macOS due to /var being a symlink to /private/var.

## Affected Tests
- tests/unit/utils/project-root.test.ts (14 tests failed)

## Error Pattern
```
AssertionError: expected '/private/var/folders/vf/...' to be '/var/folders/vf/...'
```

## Root Cause
macOS symlinks /var -> /private/var. The findProjectRoot function returns the resolved (real) path while tests expect the original path.

## Test Output
/private/tmp/claude/-Users-olliesomers-dev-clier/tasks/b6614b5.output

## Possible Fixes
1. Use fs.realpathSync() on expected paths in tests
2. Normalize paths before comparison
3. Use path comparison that accounts for symlinks
close_reason: Fixed by resolving symlinks in test setup using fs.realpathSync()

title: CRITICAL: Restore daemon architecture for multi-session agent use
description: The PM2 removal broke the fundamental use case: multiple short-lived Claude Code agent sessions managing the same pipeline. OLD PM2 BEHAVIOR: (1) 'clier start' started watcher as PM2 daemon, returned immediately (2) PM2 daemon persisted independently (3) Any terminal could run 'clier status/logs/stop' and access the same processes. NEW BROKEN BEHAVIOR: (1) 'clier start' blocks terminal forever (2) All state trapped in that process's memory (3) Other terminals can't access ProcessManager/LogManager instances. SOLUTION NEEDED: Restore daemon mode. Options: (A) Bring back PM2 dependency, (B) Implement native daemon using detached child_process + IPC/socket, (C) Use alternative daemon manager. The native implementation was correct to fix PM2's race condition, but removing daemon persistence was a fatal regression.
close_reason: Daemon architecture fully implemented - Phases 1-4 complete with working multi-agent session support

title: Fix test suite isolation - tests timeout when run together
description:
## Problem
Tests pass individually but timeout when running the full suite (350+ tests).

## Affected Tests
- tests/e2e/pipeline.test.ts
- tests/e2e/circuit-breaker.test.ts  
- tests/e2e/continue-on-failure.test.ts
- tests/performance/event-processing.test.ts
- tests/unit/safety/rate-limiter.test.ts

## Root Cause
vitest.config.ts uses `singleFork: true` which runs all tests sequentially in one process. This causes:
- Resource contention (timers, event emitters, Bottleneck limiters)
- Lingering state from previous tests affecting subsequent ones
- Cumulative slowdown over 300+ tests

## Potential Solutions
1. Add proper cleanup (afterEach) to tests that use timers/limiters
2. Increase test timeouts for E2E tests
3. Consider running test suites in separate processes
4. Review vitest poolOptions configuration
close_reason: Fixed by: 1) Adding afterEach cleanup to rate-limiter.test.ts to stop Bottleneck instances, 2) Removing singleFork: true from vitest config to enable parallel test execution, 3) Reducing E2E test timeouts. Full suite now runs in 8.5s (was 434s).
